alert.note: Alert for Roger Mills; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 6:23PM CDT until June 06 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Oklahoma, Dewey and Ellis. In western Oklahoma, Custer, Roger Mills and Washita. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 623 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hammon, Canute, Leedey, Butler, Foss, Moorewood, Foss Reservoir, Angora and Stafford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
